maintext.text:
Commander,
I have found something.

It's the shuttle.

leftButton.lbText: Try and contact Robin, quick!

rightButton.rbText: Good to know. Try to establish a connection and contact me if it worked.

maintext.text:
Commander,

I have already established a connection to the shuttle.

You can talk to Dr. Muller right away.

leftButton.lbText:
Very good, thanks.

Robin, how are you?

rightButton.rbText:
I guess you're not big on losing time.

Robin, do you read me?

maintext.text:
Hello, Commander.
I am fine, but more importantly:
It worked.
The explosion ripped me out of the current and I was able to navigate over the trench.

But the shuttle is in bad condition.

leftButton.lbText: Give me a status update on the shuttle.

rightButton.rbText: Thank god you're fine. What's the situation down there?

maintext.text:
Fuel reserves are at 20 percent.

The storage room is flooding, but I was able to seal off that section.

Oxygen and life support:
...
Are at zero percent.

leftButton.lbText:
Okay, don't panic. We can handle this.
C.U.R.E., does she have enough fuel reserves to make her way back?

rightButton.rbText: Well, that doesn't sound good. I think this means the end for our mission. C.U.R.E., she needs to return to the station immediately.

maintext.text:
Yes, Commander.

If she engages the autopilot to immediately return to the station, the fuel reserves should be enough to at least get the shuttle back.
This way the mission would not be a total failure.

leftButton.lbText:
Only the shuttle?

Not a total failure?

What about Robin?

rightButton.rbText: Can't she somehow fix the shuttle enough to make it to the excavation site?

maintext.text:
I do not see any other options to complete the mission successfully at this point.

Dr. Muller should try to get the shuttle back to base.

leftButton.lbText: Why do you keep talking about only saving the shuttle?

rightButton.rbText: So Robin's fate is sealed?

maintext.text:
Commander, as Dr. Muller already said, her entire oxygen reserves have been destroyed in the explosion.

She has ten minutes at most until she loses consciousness and suffocates, that is not nearly enough to reach the station.

leftButton.lbText:
C.U.R.E.
That cannot happen!
Any alternatives?

rightButton.rbText:
I understand.
She's supposed to save the shuttle so that we can give it another try later.

maintext.text:
I am sorry, Commander.

This outcome is unavoidable.

The success of the mission is our first priority.

Dr. Muller is only collateral damage.

leftButton.lbText:
I will not let that happen!

Robin, are you there?

rightButton.rbText:
Hm,
if we're able to get the shuttle back to the station and do some repairs, the Professor could give it another try.

maintext.text:
Commander,
I heard C.U.R.E.

Don't even think for a moment that I'm giving up without a fight!

You two need to come up with something! Right. Now.

leftButton.lbText: Listen, I have a pretty brilliant idea.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay, okay.
Now this might be a stupid idea, but you could do the following.

maintext.text: I'm all ears.

leftButton.lbText:
Doesn't the shuttle have a set of diving equipment on board?
Could you check that please.

rightButton.rbText: You need to find the shuttle's diving equipment.

maintext.text:
Yes, I have four complete sets of diving equipment on board.

Are you suggesting I swim back to the station?
THAT is your idea?

You do know how deep we are and how cold the water is here, right?

leftButton.lbText: No, of course you're not supposed to swim back.

rightButton.rbText: Well, I was considering it.

maintext.text:
I think I know what you're thinking.

If I bring the oxygen tanks from the diving equipment into the cockpit, and connect them to the life support, I will easily be able to make it back to the station.

leftButton.lbText:
Uhm,
yeah sure, that was exactly my plan.

rightButton.rbText: And you're sure you don't want to swim back?

maintext.text:
Don't be ridiculous!

I wouldn't make it a hundred meters.

Sometimes I really feel like you don't care about me.

Anyway, I'm going to bring the oxygen tanks into the cockpit now.

leftButton.lbText:
Of course I care about you.

I wasn't being serious.

rightButton.rbText:
Yes,
do that.

maintext.text:
I am connecting the oxygen tanks to the shuttle's life support system.

The connectors are incompatible, I need to jury-rig them.

But that shouldn't take long.

leftButton.lbText:
Understood.
In the meantime I'll let C.U.R.E. calculate a course back to the station.

rightButton.rbText: Immediately set course for the station as soon as you're done.

maintext.text:
But we still need those samples.
It doesn't make any sense to turn back now that we're almost there.
I'm already on the other side of the trench, from here it's only a couple hundred meters to the excavation.

leftButton.lbText:
No,
you'll come back immediately.
The samples are not worth risking your life over.

rightButton.rbText:
Yes,
that's a good point.
Maybe you should try even if it's quite risky.

maintext.text:
I already knew that it might get dangerous when I volunteered for this mission.

I'm setting course for the dig site.

See you later.

Over and Out.

leftButton.lbText:
No,
don't do that.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay,
good luck!

maintext.text:
Commander,
Dr. Muller has closed the connection.

She is on her way to the excavation site.

leftButton.lbText: That's what I thought. Keep an eye on her position.

rightButton.rbText: Thank you for stating the obvious. Do you have anything useful to contribute?

maintext.text:
I have also been able to collect some data on the current that the shuttle was caught in.

It does not seem to be of natural origin.

leftButton.lbText:
Not natural?
What could've caused it then?
There's nobody out here.

rightButton.rbText:
How can that be?
Your data must be unreliable.

maintext.text:
I am currently unable to precisely locate the source.

My scans were also unable to detect anything suspicious in the vicinity of the trench.

Shall I evaluate more data to try and identify the source of the anomaly?

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, do that.

Find out where the anomaly might have originated.

rightButton.rbText:
No,
focus on the shuttle.
We need to watch over Robin.

maintext.text:
Affirmative, Commander.

I will analyse more data and try to locate the source of the anomaly.

leftButton.lbText: Understood.

maintext.text:
Affirmative, Commander.

I will oversee Dr. Muller and the surroundings of the shuttle.

leftButton.lbText: Understood.

maintext.text:
Commander,
I've arrived at the dig site earlier than expected, and will now try to mine new rock samples.

As soon as I have them I will immediately make my way back to the station.

Promise.

leftButton.lbText:
Robin,
C.U.R.E. has analysed the current and discovered that it was not of natural origin.

rightButton.rbText:
Robin,
somebody caused the current on purpose to stop you.

maintext.text:
Does that mean I was attacked?

The last time we've had problems out here I wasn't almost pulled into an infinite abyss.

Things escalated pretty quickly this time.

leftButton.lbText: Maybe C.U.R.E. is mistaken and the current was natural after all.

rightButton.rbText: I can't imagine why anyone would want to seriously endanger you.

maintext.text:
I think we both know that there have been strange happenings here since we arrived at the station.
And I'm not talking about Professor Orlow.

There is something in the water, and it doesn't want us to have these samples.

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, that's what I'm worried about too.

How far are you with the samples?

rightButton.rbText:
Well, that all sounds very mysterious.

Are you finally done with the samples?

maintext.text:
Almost got it.
But you need to see this:
I'm back at the rock where we took the first samples.
It looks... different.
It almost seems like the surface is transparent. I can see a faint shimmer below.

leftButton.lbText: That sounds eerie.

rightButton.rbText: That sounds impressive.

maintext.text:
Strange...

It wasn't there the last time...
Anyway.
I will now put the shuttle's drill to the surface.
...
I'm through the uppermost layer, now drilling deeper.

leftButton.lbText: Please be careful!

rightButton.rbText: Get a move on!

maintext.text:
Wow, it's...

beautiful.

Everywhere around me there's small glistening stars in the water. It almost looks like the night sky, but deep underwater.

leftButton.lbText: That sounds incredible.

rightButton.rbText: You should get away from there.

maintext.text:
Yes.
I'm now collecting the samples with the shuttle's grippers.
...
...
Almost done.
There we are.
I have the new samples!

Now back to the station?

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, plot a direct course back to the station.
And no detours.

rightButton.rbText:
Not yet,
take a look around.
Maybe you'll discover something interesting.

maintext.text:
Already on my way.

I'll contact you again as soon as I'm back on the station.

If I don't run out of oxygen first, fingers crossed!

Oh well, here goes nothing.

Over and Out.

leftButton.lbText: Over and Out.

rightButton.rbText:
Wait!
If you run out of oxygen?
Robin!?

maintext.text:
I don't know.

Maybe I should turn back.
My oxygen reserves have to last me for the whole return trip. I'd rather set course for the station now and get back to you as soon as I've arrived.

Over and Out.

leftButton.lbText:
Fine.
See you later then.

Over and Out.

rightButton.rbText:
Oh come on!
This is a unique opportunity for us.
We need to conduct more research.

maintext.text:
Commander,
Dr. Muller has closed the channel.

My calculations indicate that she should barely make it to the station with her current oxygen reserves.

leftButton.lbText:
Thank you, C.U.R.E.
Contact me as soon as she's boarded the station.

rightButton.rbText:
Thank you, C.U.R.E.
Have you been able to collect more data about this anomaly by now?

maintext.text: I will do that, Commander.

leftButton.lbText: Over and Out.

maintext.text:
Unfortunately not, Commander.

I currently possess no new information about the rogue current or its origin.

leftButton.lbText:
Okay,
get back to me as soon as you know more.

rightButton.rbText: Then try harder. I want to know who or what we're dealing with out there.

maintext.text: ***offline***

leftButton.lbText: [wait]

maintext.text:
Commander,
Dr. Muller has not yet arrived at the station.

I will contact you as soon as her shuttle has docked at the station.

leftButton.lbText: [wait]
